question: What are the characteristics of tightly coupled system?
options: ['i) Same clock, usually shared memory', 'ii) Communication is via this shared memory', 'iii) Multiprocessors', 'iv) Different clock']
option1: i) Same clock, usually shared memory
option2: ii) Communication is via this shared memory

question: What are the characteristics of tightly coupled system?
options: ['i) Different clock', 'ii) Use communication links', 'iii) Same clock', 'iv) Distributed systems']

question: What are the characteristics of mutual exclusion using centralized approach?
options: ['a) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests', 'b) It requires request,reply and release per critical section entry', 'c) The method is free from starvation', 'd) All of the mentioned']
option1: a) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests
option2: b) It requires request,reply and release per critical section entry
option3: c) The method is free from starvation

question: What are the characteristics of fully distributed approach?
options: ['i) When responses are received from all processes, then  process can enter its Critical Section', 'ii) When process exits its critical section, the process sends reply messages to all its deferred requests.', 'iii) It requires request,reply and release per critical section entry', 'iv) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests']
option1: i) When responses are received from all processes, then  process can enter its Critical Section
option2: ii) When process exits its critical section, the process sends reply messages to all its deferred requests.
option3: iii) It requires request,reply and release per critical section entry
option4: iv) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests

question: What are the advantages of token(with rings) passing approach?
options: ['i) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests', 'ii) No starvation if the ring is unidirectional', 'iii) There are many messages passed per section entered if few users want to get in section', 'iv) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests']
option1: i) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests
option2: ii) No starvation if the ring is unidirectional
option3: iii) There are many messages passed per section entered if few users want to get in section
option4: iv) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests

question: What are the characteristics of atomicity?
options: ['a) All operations associated are executed to completion or none are performed', 'b) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests', 'c) When responses are received from all processes, then the process can enter its Critical Section', 'd) Use communication links']
option1: a) All operations associated are executed to completion or none are performed
option2: b) One processor as coordinator which handles all requests
option3: c) When responses are received from all processes, then the process can enter its Critical Section

question: What things are the transaction coordinator is responsible for?
options: ['a) Starting the execution of the transaction', 'b) Breaking transaction into a number of subtransactions', 'c) Coordinating the termination of the transaction', 'd) All of the mentioned']
option1: a) Starting the execution of the transaction
option2: b) Breaking transaction into a number of subtransactions
option3: c) Coordinating the termination of the transaction

question: Which of the following advantages follows the single coordinator approach?
options: ['a) Simple implementation', 'b) Simple deadlock handling', 'c) bottleneck', 'd) All of the mentioned']

question: Which of the following disadvantages follows the single coordinator approach?
options: ['a) Bottleneck', 'b) Slow response', 'c) Deadlock', 'd) One request per second']

question: What are the disadvantages of majority protocol?
options: ['a) Complicated implementation', 'b) Deadlock cannot occur easily', 'c) Bottleneck', 'd) All of the mentioned']

question: What are the parts of a global unique identifier?
options: ['a) Local unique timestamp', 'b) Remote timestamp', 'c) Clock number', 'd) All of the mentioned']

question: Which are the two complementary deadlock-prevention schemes using timestamps?
options: ['a) The wait-die & wound-wait scheme', 'b) The wait-n-watch scheme', 'c) The wound-wait scheme', 'd) The wait-wound & wound-wait scheme']
